metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14469 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The IKEv1 parser in tcpdump before 4.9.3 has a buffer over-read in print-isakmp.c:ikev1_n_print().

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14469` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.9.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9.3-0ubuntu0.14.04.1+esm1').
